div.p: SANTINI, Giovanni (1787-1877), Italian astronomer, born 30th January 1787 at Caprese, in the province of Arezzo, was from 1813 director of the observatory at Padua. He wrote Elementi di Astronomia (2 vols. 1820, 2d ed. 1830), Teoria degli Stromenti ottici (2 vols. 1828), and a great many scientific memoirs and notices, among which are five catalogues of telescopic stars between +10° and -15° declination, from observations made at the Padua observatory. He died June 26, 1877.
